column5: anyone know of a shop in toronto east end preferably that will tear down my reels clean and lubricate them for me please no diy advice i am not interested in doing it myself just not my thing i have both spinning and baitcasters thanks for any help
2shimano baitcast 1 shimano spinning 1 abu garcia revo premier
Aikmans in Mississausage. Not east end but as good as it gets.  http://www.weblocal.ca/aikman-a-sporting-goods-repair-mississauga-on.html
Cant beat that! Once you've done it the first time its' all gravy from there on in and for the money you'd save you could buy a spool of line of FisherPete.
yes i get that but put a screwdriver in my hand and all will end up in the garbage lol
Had a member service my Abu C3s a couple years ago.  Were squeeling. Great job. Fair price. In Markham Name is ah_long. Try PM him.
Had a member service my Abu C3s a couple years ago. Were squeeling. Great job. Fair price. In Markham Name is ah_long. Try PM him. thanks for the info
do it yourself   i guess you missed the please no diy advice i am not interested in doing it myself just not my thing
Send the Shimanos to Peterborough.  Go to the Shimano website and print out a work order.  They will be back better than new in about 2 weeks

Rob I take all my Shimano reels that need service up to them in Peterborough at the end of the open water season (in a few weeks) - I'd be more than happy to bring yours up at the same time and get them back to you when we meet up again. I'm dropping one off for another board member already. Just let me know!  Pete

Rob I take all my Shimano reels that need service up to them in Peterborough at the end of the open water season (in a few weeks) - I'd be more than happy to bring yours up at the same time and get them back to you when we meet up again.
